Not only are we 80ms behind because of our nerves etc, we are also behind due to the speed of light. For example if the speed of light was really slow like 10m/s, it would take a long time for the light to travel from 60m down the road to where you are and therefore when the light reaches you, you are seeing in the past. Its the same with the actual speed of light but just to a smaller scale. So if you see an object 1000m metres away from you, it might take 0.001 seconds for the light to reach you and therefore you are seeing 0.001 seconds in the past. Every star we see we are seeing in the past but at different pasts. One star could be 1500 light years away and so we are seeing that star (when the light reaches us) 1500 years in the past. Another star could be 2000 light years away so we see that star 2000 years in the past.

19- #Atoms
Smallest particle is a string.
Prior to the Quran philosophers thought that the atom was the smallest indivisible component of matter. However today we know that this is false. Atoms are composed of electrons, neutrons and protons. Those neutrons and protons are made of quarks, and lately those quarks turned-out to be made of strings. However 1400 years ago the Quran contradicted the common knowledge of the time, it stated that the atom is not the smallest part.

[Quran 6.95] It is Allah Who splits the grains and the nuclei. He brings the living from the dead, and He brings the dead from the living. Such is Allah. So how could you deviate?



Nucleus In Arabic means "Nawat نواة". Its plural nuclei in Arabic is "nawa نَّوَىٰ". So the Quran says that God splits the nucleus. This means that the atom is not the smallest particle.

[Quran 10:61] Whatever you may be doing, and whatever portion you may be reciting from the Quran, and whatever deed you may be doing, We [Allah] do witness when you are doing it. And nothing is hidden from your Lord (so much as) the weight of an atom on Earth nor in heaven, not less than that nor more but is (written) in a clear record (on the Preserved Tablet).



So the atom is not the smallest part of an atom. Today we know from String Theory that the smallest mass is the mass of a string.



The vibration of the string determines its mass. However this was portrayed in the Quran 1400 years before it was discovered. The Quran portrays the smallest particle as a wick.

[Quran4.49] Have you not considered those who claim purity for themselves? Rather, Allah purifies whom He wills, and they will not be wronged by a wick.



Fateel فَتِيلً means wick. The smallest thing is a wick.



The wick in the Quran looks exactly like the string in String Theory.

From String Theory we know that the smallest mass is the mass of a string. The vibration of the string determines its mass. However this was portrayed in the Quran 1400 years before it was discovered. The Quran says that the smallest mass is a pluck.

[Quran4.124] But whoever works righteousness, whether male or female, and is a believer, those will enter Paradise, and will not be wronged by a pluck.



Nakara نقر means pluck. Pluck the string of a musical instrument means نقر أوتار العود. Nakir نقير means vibrations of a string. In this verse Nakiran نَقِيرًا means a single vibration of a string. So in the Quran the smallest mass is the single vibration of a string.

In this verse the smallest mass is a pluck and in the previous verse the smallest particle is a wick. Both verses are describing the same smallest particle. Today we know what it is, this is a vibrating string.

How could an illiterate man who lived 1400 years ago have known that the smallest particle is a vibrating string?

(The Bible says that stars burn like lamps, that is, it is a chemical reaction Revelation 8:10. However in reality there is no such thing as burning, instead atoms fuse inside stars by gravity, a nuclear reaction not a chemical one).

18- #Planetary Orbits
All stars and planets have orbits.
For centuries it was believed that Earth is fixed and the sun, moon and planets revolve around it. However 1400 years ago the Quran said that not only the sun and moon but also Earth moves in a designated path:

[Quran 39.5] [Allah] Created the heavens and the Earth in truth. He overlaps the night over the day and overlaps the day over the night, and enslaved the sun and the moon, ALL MOVE (كل يجري) to a prerecorded destiny. Is He not the Exalted, the Forgiver?



Here the Quran is referring to ALL MOVING: not only the sun and moon but also Earth. In Arabic grammar there is difference between the singular (one), binary (two) and plural (three or more). The reference to binary is "Kulahuma Yajreean كلاهما يجريان" however the Quran said "Kullon yajree كل يجري" referring to the plural (three or more). Since the sun and moon are just two but the Quran is referring to three or more then according to the Quran all the three move sun, moon and Earth.

[Quran 86.11] And the sky that returns.



"Al-rajeh الرَّجْعِ" means returns to the same location. Today we know that all planets return to the same locations in their respective orbits.

How could an illiterate man who lived 1400 years ago have known that planets return to their original locations?

Mistranslations: Quran 18.86 sun setting in a spring.

(The Christian Bible says that Earth is a 2 dimensional flat disk and the heaven is like a canopy solid like bronze: Isaiah 40:22)

2- #Shape Of Universe
Curvature of space.
Every observer in the universe sees the observable universe around him as an expanding sphere, 93 light-years in diameter. This is true for any observer even those outside our observable universe. What we see and what they see is the same, an expanding sphere 93 light-years in diameter.

Assuming the universe is isotropic, the distance to the edge of the observable universe is roughly the same in every direction. That is, the observable universe has a spherical volume (a ball) centered on the observer. Every location in the universe has its own observable universe, which may or may not overlap with the one centered on Earth...

The radius of the observable universe is therefore estimated to be about 46.5 billion light-years and its diameter about 28.5 gigaparsecs (93 billion light-years...)
Wikipedia, Observable Universe, 2020
The observable universe is a sphere. This was known recently, however this was portrayed in the Quran 1400 years before it was discovered.

[Quran 55.33] O society of jinn and humans! If you can escape the diameters of the heavens and the earth, go ahead and escape. But you will not escape except with authorization.



"Aktar أَقْطَارِ" means diameters. But diameter is strictly property of circles or spheres. Since Earth and the heavens have diameters then the according to the Quran Earth and the observable universe are spheres. Man on Earth and the jinn in the heavens see the observable universe as a sphere.

How could an illiterate man who lived 1400 years ago have known that the observable universe is a sphere?

Observers everywhere see the same properties for the universe.

The cosmological principle is usually stated formally as 'Viewed on a sufficiently large scale, the properties of the universe are the same for all observers.' This amounts to the strongly philosophical statement that the part of the universe which we can see is a fair sample, and that the same physical laws apply throughout. In essence, this in a sense says that the universe is knowable and is playing fair with scientists.
Wikipedia, Cosmologic Principle, 2020
"Viewed on a sufficiently large scale, the properties of the universe are the same for all observers" this was known recently, however this was portrayed in the Quran 1400 years before it was discovered.

[Quran 79.27] Are you more difficult to create, or the heaven? He constructed it. He raised its thickness, and equalized it.



"He raised its thickness" today we know that this is correct because the universe is expanding (radius is increasing).

"Sawwa سَوَّا" means made equal. "And equalized it" means made the thickness equal for all observers. Today we know that this is correct because all observers see the same radius. (If Earth were flat and the sky were a dome, as some skeptics claim, then the height at the center would be bigger than height at the edges, hence observers would not see the same thickness.)

How could an illiterate man who lived 1400 years ago have known that all observers see equal radii?

My life is an escalator. Here's why:

The coolest part about this video is understanding the fact that time is literally an illusion in the way that we percieve it, because of the way our brains are built. We are a sensory blob of flesh taking information in and building a perception of the world based off of this, and everything we think we see is actually a memory, so of course from the point in time we are born to the point in time that we die, we percieve time like an arrow going forward because we are constantly creating new memories. But in actuality, time is just a thing. The universe is just a thing. Heat death and the big bang are simultaneous. We just don't experience it that way because it's basically impossible to do so as a living, conscious being (as far as we know right now). Again, you exist and get to see the world in the time you, well, exist. And there's an infinite number of you ahead of you in time and behind you in time. You just feel like you're moving forward. Think of it kind of like an escalator. Each step comes out, moves to the end and then goes back in. And it cycles. Except the escalator never stops.

So if it takes time for your brain to receive and process the information around you, then let's say there's a hypothetical situation where someone shoots you in the face. As you cower in fear, the gunman fires a deathshot through your head.

Because of the delay in time, would you even hear the gunfire? Would your death be instantaneous and out of the complete blue? Say, some sort of conscious afterlife exists in this hypothetical scenario. Immediately after dying, would you say 'wow, that was a loud gunshot!', or would you say, 'where was the sound?'

Same goes for falling off buildings. Would you even feel the impact? Or what about being decapitated? (Actually, with decapitation, the neck is right next to the brain, and the head typically lasts for more than 15-30 seconds still being alive. So you would definitely feel it.)

Just a thought. :)

The mind is a hall of mirrors in which each new though reflects on previous thoughts and thus fancies itself as their “thinker" - a seemingly enduring "I," “observer,” or "self" - separate from the ever-changing stream of thoughts and emotions. For all its machinations the “thinker” is just as transitory as every other thought - being itself merely a sequence of thoughts about thoughts about thoughts ad infinitum.

This duplicity ostensibly allows the mind to distance itself from its shadowy, more unpalatable, impulses – its envy, its greed, its fears, its animosities - by fabricating a make-believe "I" separate from "them." It seeks to create a chasm which hides this darker side from itself but which also prevents the light of awareness from reaching and illuminating it. "I" do not have "those" reprehensible qualities or, "I" am burdened and distressed by "those" feelings. The "I" can then make half-hearted efforts to change "those" unwelcome characteristics without fundamentally acknowledging "them" as itself. "They" are not me; "they" are "happening" to me. It is a devilish ruse meant to hamper the disconcerting recognition that the "I" is, in fact, "those" negative attributes. The mind, in effect, seeks to bury its head in the sand and pretend it is "something" other than "those" unacceptable parts of itself.

So long as that subterfuge persists - an "observer" or "experiencer" separate from its "experience" - there is little possibility of integrating and resolving the disowned impulses. The "experiencer," being a fiction, is impotent and has negligible effect on "its" experience. Only a clear choiceless awareness of the stream of experience, unclouded by the chatter of an imaginary "self" or "thinker," can expedite that integration. In that benevolent silence the mind can begin to spontaneously perceive the way out of its maze of "self"-imposed contradictions .

The undivided, “self-less,” mind bestows coherence and lucidity on all its encounters. It is the only truly sane mind amongst all. The divided mind, try as it may not to do so, exacerbates the pandemonium, disorder, and confusion in the world via its dissonant vacillation between a nonexistent "thinker" and "its" thoughts.

The conclusion that we live in the past is from my understanding wrong for 2 reasons. 1: There have been tests done where  the reaction time people had on images shown was tested, and  all nerve signals leading up the each reaction to each picture was measured. What was found is that the first nerve signal leading up to the reaction happened before the image was shown. 
2: There is some logic to a perspective of time being that there is no past nor future, that all happens in the now. That now is the only time there is - that time is the difference we see when changing into a different version of now. This can as an example explain why quantum physics have observed an particle appearing to be 2 places at the same time.

However it is true in the sense that the light we see is a reflection of what already have happened - because light have to travel from the reflective object to our eyes.

We all live in the now and we have lived in the past and we are going to live in the future

Nothing is a twofold definition. On the one hand, it is as incomprehensible as infinity. It is the conception of the opposite of a law of nature. Objects of distinction are finite in form, and because of our grasp of this, we have an idea of infinity. The same is said for nothing; if there is something, what is nothing? It is the opposite; an idea dependent on the knowledge of something. And on the other hand, we do experience it, but only as a present absence of something, not actually nothing.

The standard definition of the speed of light is its speed as measured in a vacuum. Your brain is not a vacuum. Even if the electric signals traveling between neurons were not actually electric signals, and were instead light, they would still not be travelling at light speed, as traveling through a medium (such as your brain) slows light down. Furthermore, light speed is still not instantaneous. Therefore even if signals travelled that fast, you'd still not feel it at the same time it happened.

The AC is not "about 50 to 60" hertz. It's either 50 Hz, like in Europe, or it's 60 Hz, like in the US. 60 Hz is more efficient, but in Europe, some person obsessed with the decimal system thought 50 Hz "made more sense". This is also unfortunate because that's the frequency of the heart's electrical signals, so if you get alternating current with that frequency through your body, and its phase matches that of the heart's signals, it could be very dangerous.

Just so everyone knows, Reflex is a little different. When presented with immediate danger and/or pain, the message will go only as far as the spine and then loop back around to the closest muscle to avoid or remove you from harm. Think of when you touch a hot burner or step on a tack, your foot or hand automatically pulls back even before the pain kicks in. You only feel the pain and realize what happened after the initial reflex movement, and this is why.

...all biology text books, and would probably overturn some well established physics of electricity too. It would also lead to a nobel price for the discoverer of such a thing.

As for having "no reason to be skeptical", there's ALWAYS reason to be skeptical. Skepticism is an approach to truth claims that demands evidence before accepting them, and is careful about standards of evidence. 

With claims that would violate known biology and physics, the "prior plausibility" of the claim is near zero, and thus the evidence to show such a thing would have to be extremely rigorous and incontrovertible. Such evidence would also immediately cause us to have to re-write...

...there are basic structures and limitations to how our neurons work - and those limits are hard limits; neurons don't change their basic principles of function as a response to training, ant the way neurons are built, and the way they function, mean that a delay, determined by the distance the neural impulses must travel in order to convey information to the brain, and the distance impulses must travel in the brain for the stimulus to be perceived, is unavoidable - determined by biology.
I started to tap myself :)

We CAN adapt and learn, that is true, but not limitlessly. There are physical limitations that our biology places upon us - with extreme dedication, and some inate physical skill, you might be able to train your body to bench press more than 400 kg - but no matter how you train or try, you will never be able to bench press 4000 kg. The physical limits of what your muscles, joints and bone can plausibly take come up well before that. Similarly....

If your argument does not include properly conducted scientific studies, published in relevant peer reviewed journals, demonstrating the plausibility of training your brain to work without the 80ms delay, then please do not bother. An argument of something that seems to violate the physics that constrain neural impulses, is nothing but an unsupported idea, unless you have really solid experimental evidence for it, properly controlled, in a scientifically rigorous manner.

That's a good point, and it would be valid if time were smooth and continuous. But it isn't. Time is digital, meaning it comes in discreet packets known as Planck time, which is 10 to the -43 seconds. Planck time is the time that it takes light in a vacuum to travel one Planck length (the smallest distance known to science).

Therefore, time can't be divided forever to infinity, so it seems to pass.

That's a good reason why you live in the past, here is another.
According to Einstein's theory of relativity, the movement of anything that has mass distorts space and time. So say you where standing still in a hallway, and I was walking towards you. Because of general relativity, my "present" would be in your "past", but if I where to walk away from you, my "now" would be cutting into your "later".
Read "The Fabric of the Cosmos" by Brian Greene, or watch the special of the same name on PBS.org

I love the human body.  The "delay" in processing happens in the thalami (thalamus) where sensory input is "filtered" and passed along to the sensory cortex for relay onto the motor cortex which tells us to move.  About 90% of sensory input is filtered or "ignored" by the thalamus...anymore than that causes sensory overload.  The latencies of peripheral nerves (hands and feet) are longer, yes....but cranial nerves and reflexes act differently.  A reflex with bypass the brain in most cases.

@montotosk True enough, but this doesn't require thought.  It only needs thought when we try to force the impressions we receive into preconceived ideas.

In the same way we're not observing the current night sky, because it takes centuries for the light of the nearest stars to reach us. Even the sun and the moon are not the current sun and moon. But that doesn't mean that we don't live "in the now". It just means there's no absolute uniform "now" everywhere, it takes time for any event and for time itself to spread and occur.

@pspheaven Think about it this way. If you look at an AC sine wave graph, each "Wave" has a positive and negative peak. in between those peaks the voltage passes through zero. But at the beginning and end of those peaks it also passes through zero. The start and end zero is shared between "Waves" so that leaves two zero points for every one 60 Hz wave. It starts at zero, goes to 120 positive V (RMS), then goes back through zero, then goes to 120 negative V (RMS). The next zero starts a new wave.

Our perception might be 80ms from the moment the event of striking a key happened, but the audio event's perception will come with an offset at 95-110ms, which confuses. For reference, at 24fps the delay between frames is about 40ms.
I online gaming about 100ms is the limit where you start to get noticably impacted by latency, and at 200-300ms it become cumbersome and annoying as you'll have to take it into account when timing actions.
FPS gamers gamers in some genres like latencies to be in low double digits, as well as having 100hz (or higher) sample rates to remove the practical compound effects of latency.
Consistently accurate reflexes take about 250-500ms
